properties.media:imagetext:
HWB
062717C
July 28, 1962
Mr. Van H. Ferguson, Chairman
Trustees Internal
Improvement Board
Tallahassee, Florida
Dear Mr. Ferguson:
You probably do not remember me because there is no reason why
you should but I remember you very well because of the really
constructive help you gave us on
Captiva when we were strugling
with erosion problems.
As one of the Commissioners of the Cap-
tiva Erosion Prevention District I am happy to tell you that we
have completed our program
and it is attracting wide-spread int-
erest - in fact a similar installation is now under construction
on Long Island, New York.
The purpose of this letter is to express the hope that you will
use your influence to bring about the creation of the Jay N.
"Ding"
Darling Wild Life Sanctuary on Sanibel,
The so called "land" in
this area is really nothing more than a myriad of tiny
mangrove
covered islands set in tidal shallows - ideal for a wading bird
and wild life sanctuary but of little value for any other purpose.
I understand that the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service are willing
to spend a substantial amount for surveys, deep wells, board walks
and other facilities to make this area into a wildlife sanctuary
of national importance.
They ask only a lease for a time
sufficient
to justify the
rather large sun required.
They are willing to
accept a cancellation of the lease if the area is not used
by them
as a wildlife sanctuary. The State has everything to gain and no-
thing to lose.
I met "Ding" Darling when I first went to Captiva nearly
twenty years
He often talked of a sanctuary on Sanibel.
Nothing would
please him more
than to have his name associated with this sanctuary.
For Florida no name would be more of an attraction for "Ding" had a
nation-wide audience many of whom knew him and all of whom admired
him as a truly great American.
Very sincerely
Harold M. Bixby
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Harold M. Bixby to Van H. Ferguson
